intro: Cirsium kaimaense, commonly known as Kaimana thistle, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, leafy stems and purple to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its foliage is covered in stiff, bristly hairs, which help protect it from herbivores and harsh environmental conditions. Cirsium kaimaense is a rare and endemic species, found primarily on the Kaimanawa Range.
